definitions.labels: (especially North American English)(especially US English)(especially North American English)(British English)(North American English)

examples.text: She spent a year in jail.
He has been released from jail.
He's gone to jail for fraud.
His lawyer worked hard to keep him out of jail.
How long has she been in jail?
He avoided jail by pleading insanity.
She could be out of jail in two years.
He was held overnight at the county jail.

wordOrigin: Middle English: based on Latin cavea. The word came into English in two forms, jaiole from Old French and gayole from Anglo-Norman French gaole (surviving in the spelling gaol), originally pronounced with a hard g, as in goat.
